item.title: A Question on Pragmaticism
item.description: I was recently reading about Pragmaticism (for an article I wrote here: Why Christians Must be Wary of Pragmaticism), and found the following definition in the Century Dictionary from 1909: pragmaticism (prag-matâ€² i-sizm), n. [pragmatic + ism.] A special and limited form of pragmatism, in which the pragmatism is restricted to the determining of the meaning of concepts (particularly of philosophic concepts) by consideration of the experimental differences in the conduct of life which would conceivably result from the affirmation or denial of the meaning in question.
